messages.content: What is the purpose of comfyui_wildcards?
The purpose of comfyui_wildcards is to recreate the wildcards plugin for Automatic1111 but for ComfyUI.
What should be created in the root of your ComfyUI install for wildcards?
A directory called 'wildcards' should be created in the root of your ComfyUI install for wildcards.
How can you activate wildcards in ComfyUI?
You can activate wildcards in ComfyUI by adding the filename surrounded by double underscores to the prompt, for example, __eyecolor__.
Can multiple wildcards be used simultaneously in ComfyUI?
Yes, multiple wildcards can be used simultaneously in ComfyUI, for example, __eyecolor__, __smile__.
How can the wildcard node generate its own seed in ComfyUI?

The wildcard node can generate its own seed in ComfyUI, which is useful for recreating something over and over again with the same seed and wildcard options. The INT output can be redirected into the seed input to use this seed with the rest of your prompts/samplers.
What is one known issue with comfyui_wildcards?
One known issue with comfyui_wildcards is that, unlike the A1111 version, the wildcard that was picked does not get replaced in the PNG info.
How can you add the new wildcards node in ComfyUI?

You can add the new wildcards node in ComfyUI by either right-clicking > Add Node > conditioning > CLIPTextEncodeWithWildcards, or double-clicking > add search text for 'wildcards' > CLIPTextEncodeWithWildcards.
